How to Cite International Journal of Hospitality Management in APA Format

Complete guide to citing International Journal of Hospitality Management in APA 7th edition with examples, unique formatting requirements, and common issues specific to this source.

International Journal of Hospitality Management presents unique citation challenges that require specific guidance beyond general source type rules. This page provides targeted help for finding citation information, handling International Journal of Hospitality Management's particular format requirements, and avoiding common mistakes specific to this platform.

üîç Try It Out

Paste a citation to check its International Journal of Hospitality Management formatting

Quick Reference: International Journal of Hospitality Management Citations

Reference List Format:
Author, A. A., & Author, B. B. (Year). Title of article. Title of Journal, volume(issue), pages. https://doi.org/xxxxx

International Journal of Hospitality Management-Specific Notes:
When citing articles from the International Journal of Hospitality Management using APA 7th edition, students must pay special attention to certain nuances that may differ from standard citation rules. A key distinction is that this journal often includes a DOI (Digital Object Identifier) for its articles, which should be formatted as a hyperlink starting with "https://doi.org/". This is a mandatory part of the citation if available, as it provides a direct, permanent link to the content. Unlike some other journals, which may not always utilize DOIs, failing to include this element can lead to an incomplete citation.

Another unique aspect is that the International Journal of Hospitality Management follows the general APA guideline for author lists, but students often get confused with the handling of multiple authors. For articles with up to 20 authors, list all authors by their last name followed by initials. This is consistent with APA‚Äôs stipulation, but students frequently encounter issues with correctly ordering and punctuating these names. Ensure commas separate authors and that an ampersand (&) precedes the last author‚Äôs name.

To avoid common mistakes, students should consistently check for a DOI and correctly apply the rule of listing up to 20 authors. Best practices include using the journal's official website or databases like PubMed to verify citation details and employing citation management tools to format references accurately. Always cross-reference with the latest APA guidelines to ensure compliance, especially when dealing with complex author lists or electronic sources.

In-Text Citation:
- Parenthetical: ([Author], [Year])
- Narrative: [Author] ([Year])

Key Points:
- Use Journal Article format with International Journal of Hospitality Management specifics
- Locate citation info on International Journal of Hospitality Management's website
- Handle International Journal of Hospitality Management's unique formatting requirements

Where to Find Citation Information on International Journal of Hospitality Management

When navigating to the International Journal of Hospitality Management through a search query like ‚Äúinternational journal of hospitality management cite‚Äù on Google, it is crucial to know how to efficiently locate the necessary citation information for your academic work. Here is a step-by-step guide that will help you find the author, publication date, title, and URL/access information, specific to the journal's layout and navigation.

Accessing the Journal

  1. Search and Navigate:
    - Begin by clicking on the official link to the International Journal of Hospitality Management, typically found on the journal's page hosted by Elsevier or another academic publishing platform. This ensures you are accessing the legitimate journal portal.

  2. Locating the Article:
    - Use the journal‚Äôs search feature or browse through recent issues to find the specific article you need. The search bar is usually at the top of the page, which allows you to enter keywords, author names, or specific article titles.

Finding Citation Information

  1. Author Byline:
    - Once you have accessed the article page, look for the author byline at the top of the article. It is typically displayed just below the article title and is formatted with the authors‚Äô names. This is crucial for proper citation.

  2. Article Title:
    - The title of the article is prominently displayed at the top of the page. Ensure you transcribe it exactly as it appears, preserving the capitalization and punctuation for accuracy in your citation.

  3. Publication Date:
    - Below the title and author information, you will typically find the publication date. It might be labeled as ‚ÄúPublished‚Äù or ‚ÄúAvailable online,‚Äù and it gives you the exact date the article was published or made available online, which is essential for your citation.

  4. DOI and URL:
    - For digital articles, the Digital Object Identifier (DOI) is crucial as it provides a permanent link to the document. Look for the DOI often listed near the top or bottom of the article page. If you need to provide a URL, it can be found in the browser‚Äôs address bar but ensure the DOI is included in your citation as it is preferred in APA format.

  5. Access Information:
    - If accessing through an academic institution, note any login or proxy information if required. When citing, you typically don‚Äôt include access dates for journal articles but ensure you have noted if it was accessed through a subscription service.

Practical Tips

  • Abstract and Full Text:

  • Review the abstract available on the article‚Äôs main page for a quick summary and ensure that you have access to the full text if necessary for direct quotes or specific data.

  • PDF and Print Options:

  • Utilize the PDF option for a downloadable version that often contains all needed citation details in a single view, sometimes included at the bottom of the first page of the article.

By following this guide, students can accurately gather the required citation details from the International Journal of Hospitality Management, ensuring compliance with APA 7th edition guidelines.

Step-by-Step: Creating Your International Journal of Hospitality Management Citation

What You Need

  1. Access to the article you want to cite.
  2. A web browser to access journal databases or Google.
  3. Basic understanding of APA format.
  4. A word processor or note-taking app to write your citation.

Step-by-Step Instructions to Create an International Journal of Hospitality Management Citation

1. Identify the Article You Want to Cite

  • Action: Locate the specific article from the International Journal of Hospitality Management that you intend to cite. This can be done through academic databases like JSTOR, ScienceDirect, or the journal's official website.
  • Verification: Ensure that you have the correct title, author names, publication year, volume number, issue number, and page range for the article.
  • Time Estimate: 5-10 minutes.

2. Gather Author Information

  • Action: Look at the top of the article to find the authors' names. Write them down in the format required by APA style, which is "Last Name, First Initial. Middle Initial." For multiple authors, separate with commas, using an ampersand (&) before the last author.
  • Verification: Confirm that you have the correct spelling of the authors' names and that they are properly formatted.
  • Time Estimate: 3-5 minutes.

3. Record the Year of Publication

  • Action: Find the year when the article was published. This information is usually located near the authors' names or at the top of the first page of the article.
  • Verification: Double-check that you have the correct year and that it is formatted in parentheses.
  • Time Estimate: 2-3 minutes.

4. Determine the Article Title

  • Action: Write down the title of the article. In APA style, only the first word of the title and subtitle, as well as any proper nouns, should be capitalized.
  • Verification: Ensure that the title is exactly as it appears in the article and that it is formatted correctly.
  • Time Estimate: 2-4 minutes.

5. Find the Journal Title and Volume Information

  • Action: Locate the title of the journal, which should be prominently displayed. Note the volume number and the issue number (if available), which is often located near the journal title.
  • Verification: Ensure that the journal title is italicized in your citation, and that the volume number is included in italics as well. The issue number should be in parentheses and not italicized.
  • Time Estimate: 3-5 minutes.

6. Locate Page Numbers

  • Action: Identify the range of pages for the article. This information is usually found at the beginning or end of the article.
  • Verification: Confirm that you have the correct page range and that it is formatted correctly with a hyphen between the first and last page.
  • Time Estimate: 2-3 minutes.

7. Create the DOI Link

  • Action: Check if the article has a DOI (Digital Object Identifier), which is typically listed on the first page of the article or in the database entry. If available, copy the DOI link.
  • Verification: Ensure that the DOI is formatted correctly. It should be preceded by "https://doi.org/" followed by the DOI number itself.
  • Time Estimate: 2-3 minutes.

8. Assemble Your Citation

  • Action: Now that you have all the components, assemble them into the correct APA format. It should look like this:
    Author, A. A., & Author, B. B. (Year). Title of article. Title of Journal, volume(issue), pages. https://doi.org/xxxxx
  • Verification: Double-check your citation for accuracy, including punctuation, capitalization, and italics.
  • Time Estimate: 5-10 minutes.

Tips for Efficiency

  • Use citation management tools: Consider using citation management software like Zotero or Mendeley. They can help you organize your references and generate citations in APA format.
  • Keep a template handy: Have a blank citation template ready for different sources. This can help streamline the process for future citations.
  • Practice makes perfect: The more you practice creating citations, the easier it will become. Consider creating a few practice citations from different sources.
  • Verify your sources: Always cross-check your information with reliable sources to ensure accuracy.

By following these steps, you can successfully create a citation for an article from the International Journal of Hospitality Management in APA format. Remember to take your time and

Real Examples from International Journal of Hospitality Management

This section provides authentic citation examples from International Journal of Hospitality Management using recent publications from 2023-2024.

I currently don‚Äôt have the ability to access or browse the internet for real-time data or recent publications from 2023-2024. However, I can guide you on how to create APA citations based on hypothetical examples from the International Journal of Hospitality Management. Here‚Äôs how you could format them:

Example 1: Standard Individual Author

  1. Scenario Description: This is a standard research article authored by one individual, focusing on the impact of digital marketing on hotel bookings.
  2. Complete Reference List Citation:
    - Smith, J. A. (2023). The role of digital marketing in increasing hotel bookings. International Journal of Hospitality Management, 102(5), 45-58. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijhm.2023.102345
  3. In-Text Citation (Parenthetical Format):
    - (Smith, 2023)
  4. In-Text Citation (Narrative Format):
    - Smith (2023) discusses the impact of digital marketing on hotel bookings.
  5. Notes: This example is noteworthy as it highlights the growing influence of digital marketing in the hospitality industry, a current trend in 2023.

Example 2: Corporate Author

  1. Scenario Description: A report by a corporate entity addressing sustainability practices in hospitality management.
  2. Complete Reference List Citation:
    - Hospitality Sustainability Council. (2023). Implementing sustainable practices in hospitality management. International Journal of Hospitality Management, 103(6), 60-75. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijhm.2023.103678
  3. In-Text Citation (Parenthetical Format):
    - (Hospitality Sustainability Council, 2023)
  4. In-Text Citation (Narrative Format):
    - According to the Hospitality Sustainability Council (2023), sustainable practices are crucial for future growth.
  5. Notes: This example is unique due to its focus on corporate authorship, reflecting the collaborative efforts in sustainability within the industry.

Example 3: Multiple Authors

  1. Scenario Description: A collaborative study on the effects of seasonal changes on hotel occupancy rates with multiple authors.
  2. Complete Reference List Citation:
    - Lee, H., Kumar, S., & Patel, R. (2023). Seasonal variations and their impact on hotel occupancy rates. International Journal of Hospitality Management, 104(7), 120-135. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijhm.2023.104901
  3. In-Text Citation (Parenthetical Format):
    - (Lee, Kumar, & Patel, 2023)
  4. In-Text Citation (Narrative Format):
    - Lee, Kumar, and Patel (2023) explore the effects of seasonal changes on occupancy rates.
  5. Notes: The article is notable for its collaborative approach, offering diverse insights from multiple experts.

Example 4: Special Formatting Case

  1. Scenario Description: An article with a long title involving a complex study on guest satisfaction metrics.
  2. Complete Reference List Citation:
    - Johnson, M. T., & Wong, L. (2023). An in-depth analysis of guest satisfaction metrics and their implications for operational strategies in the hospitality sector. International Journal of Hospitality Management, 105(8), 150-170. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijhm.2023.105234
  3. In-Text Citation (Parenthetical Format):
    - (Johnson & Wong, 2023)
  4. In-Text Citation (Narrative Format):
    - Johnson and Wong (2023) provide an extensive analysis of guest satisfaction metrics.
  5. Notes: This example stands out for its detailed analytical approach and the length of its title, making the formatting of the citation critical.

These examples illustrate the use of APA 7th edition citation style, capturing a range of authorship and content types typical for the International Journal of Hospitality Management. Adjust the details as necessary if you obtain actual articles from the journal.

Common Issues When Citing International Journal of Hospitality Management

Problem 1: Identifying Authors

Issue Description:
Students often face challenges when trying to accurately identify and list authors for articles from the International Journal of Hospitality Management. This is because journal articles may have multiple authors, and their names can sometimes be presented in an order that is confusing or unclear.

Why it Happens:
The International Journal of Hospitality Management, like many academic journals, presents author names in varying formats. These can include different naming conventions based on cultural differences, usage of initials, or non-standardized formats across different articles.

Solution:
1. Locate the Author Information: Start by locating the author section, usually found at the beginning of the article, either on the cover page or immediately after the abstract.
2. Follow the Author Order: List authors in the exact order they appear in the article. This order is significant and must be preserved in citations.
3. Use Full Names When Available: Use full names if provided. If only initials are given, ensure they are used correctly in the citation.
4. Consult the Journal‚Äôs Author Guidelines: Check if the journal provides any specific guidance on how authors should be listed.

Before/After Example:
- Incorrect: Smith, J., & Doe, J.
- Correct: Smith, John., & Doe, Jane.

Problem 2: Date Formats

Issue Description:
Students often struggle with the correct date format when citing articles, as they may be unsure about which date to use and how to format it correctly according to APA guidelines.

Why it Happens:
The confusion often arises because the publication date can be found in multiple places and in different formats, such as online publication date, print issue date, or even a range of dates if the issue covers multiple months.

Solution:
1. Identify the Correct Date: Use the year of publication as listed on the article‚Äôs main page or in the citation information provided by the journal.
2. Format According to APA: In APA 7th edition, the format is "Year, Month Day" if detailed, or just "Year" if only that is provided.
3. Use Consistent Format: Always ensure consistency in how dates are presented across all citations.

Before/After Example:
- Incorrect: 2023-07-15
- Correct: 2023

Problem 3: URL Handling

Issue Description:
Students frequently make mistakes when including URLs in citations, often using incorrect links or failing to format them properly in the reference list.

Why it Happens:
The International Journal of Hospitality Management can have articles available across different platforms, such as the publisher's website or database access points. This can lead to confusion regarding which URL to include.

Solution:
1. Use the DOI if Available: Always prefer the Digital Object Identifier (DOI) over URLs, as it is a permanent and stable link.
2. Find the Correct URL: If a DOI is not available, use the URL from the publisher‚Äôs website rather than a database link.
3. Format the URL Correctly: Ensure there are no line breaks or unnecessary punctuation in the URL.

Before/After Example:
- Incorrect: http://www.database.com/article123
- Correct: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijhm.2023.102345

Problem 4: Access Requirements

Issue Description:
Accessing articles behind paywalls or requiring institutional access can be problematic, leading to improper citation due to lack of complete information.

Why it Happens:
The International Journal of Hospitality Management is often accessible through academic institutions or subscription services, meaning students may not always have direct access to the necessary details for citation.

Solution:
1. Use Institutional Access: Leverage your academic institution‚Äôs library resources to access the full articles.
2. Request Articles through Interlibrary Loan: If access is unavailable, use interlibrary loan services offered by your institution.
3. Cite What You Can Access: If you are unable to access the full article, cite the abstract or summary you have access to, but clearly note it is not the full article.

Before/After Example:
- Incorrect: Citing without knowing full details.
- Correct: Citing with all available details and noting limitations if necessary.

By addressing these common issues with specific solutions, students can improve the accuracy and reliability of their citations for the International Journal of Hospitality Management.

Note: For general Journal Article citation errors, see How to Cite Journal Article.

Frequently Asked Questions About International Journal of Hospitality Management

Q: How can I navigate the International Journal of Hospitality Management's website to find the necessary citation information for APA format?

A: To locate citation information, search for the desired article on the journal's website. Click on the article title to access its detailed page, where you'll find the authors, publication date, article title, journal name, volume, issue number, and DOI‚Äîall essential elements for APA citation.

Q: How should I handle unique author formats when citing articles from the International Journal of Hospitality Management?

A: If an article from the International Journal of Hospitality Management has multiple authors, list up to 20 authors using their last names followed by initials. Separate each author with a comma, and use an ampersand (&) before the last author's name in your citation.

Q: What should I do if the publication date format for an article from the International Journal of Hospitality Management is unclear?

A: The publication date should be clearly noted on the article page. In APA format, use the year of publication in parentheses, followed by a period. If the year is unclear, check the article's PDF or the journal's archive for confirmation.

Q: Are there specific URL or access requirements when citing an article from the International Journal of Hospitality Management in APA format?

A: Include the DOI at the end of your citation if available, as it provides a stable link to the article. If no DOI is available, use the URL of the journal's homepage. Do not include database URLs or access dates unless the content is likely to change over time.

Q: How does citing the International Journal of Hospitality Management differ from other journal article sources in APA format?

A: Citing the International Journal of Hospitality Management follows standard APA guidelines for journal articles, but you should pay attention to the DOI, which is often provided. This differs from some journals that may not include DOIs, thus requiring you to use URLs more frequently.
